RECREATIONAL.summary: It is illegal for adults to possess cannabis in Utah unless they are registered medical cannabis cardholders in compliance with the state's medical cannabis program. Recreational possession remains a criminal offense under Utah law.
RECREATIONAL.gov_quote: "Except as authorized by this chapter, it is unlawful for a person knowingly and intentionally to possess or use a controlled substance, unless it was obtained under a valid prescription or order, directly from a practitioner while acting in the course of the person's professional practice, or as otherwise authorized by law."

MEDICAL.summary: It is legal for registered medical marijuana patients in Utah to possess cannabis if they hold a valid medical cannabis card, possess only approved forms, and do not exceed the legal possession limits of up to 113 grams of unprocessed cannabis flower or 20 grams of total THC in other forms within a 30-day period. Patients must comply with all Utah Medical Cannabis Program requirements, including registration and documentation.
MEDICAL.gov_quote: You can buy medical cannabis at any licensed medical cannabis pharmacy in Utah.
